bill_title: revise the types of taxes that the state may enter into compacts with tribes.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the types of taxes that the state may enter into compacts with tribes. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 10-12A-4 be amended to read as follows: 10-12A-4. The department may enter into tax collection agreements with any Indian tribe under the provisions of this chapter and chapter 1-24. These agreements may provide for the collection of any of the following state taxes and any tribal taxes imposed by a tribe that are identical to the following state taxes: (1) The retail sales and service tax imposed by chapter 10-45; (2) The use tax imposed by chapter 10-46; (3) The contractors' excise tax imposed by chapter 10-46A; (4) The alternate contractors' excise tax imposed by chapter 10-46B; (5) The cigarette tax imposed by chapter 10-50; (6) The motor vehicle excise tax imposed by chapter 32-5B; or (7) The fuel excise tax imposed by chapter 10-47B ; (8) The taxation of telephone companies valued by chapter 10-33, not including the taxes imposed on gross receipts by § 10-33-21; (9) The taxation of electric, heating, water, and gas companies valued pursuant to chapter 10-35; (10) The taxation of rural water supply companies valued pursuant to chapter 10-36A; or (11) The taxation of pipeline companies pursuant valued pursuant to chapter 10-37 . The agreement may provide for the retention by the department of an agreed-upon percentage of the gross revenue as an administrative fee.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
